verbs.description: detrain (third-person singular simple present detrains, present participle detraining, simple past and past participle detrained)

entries.meaning: (rail transport, intransitive) To exit from a train; to disembark
examples: If you plan to detrain at the next stop, please begin gathering your belongings.

entries.meaning: (rail transport, transitive) to remove a passenger or passengers from a train; to evacuate passengers from a train.
examples: Following the accident passengers were detrained through the rear cab.

entries.meaning: (of an athlete) to reduce one's training, particularly during the offseason, in preparation for a cycle of retraining.
